instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]Trackpad sensor 820-3115
threads.message:
Hi,
i have a problem with this board 820-3115, i think it's a problem with sensor trackpad.
I have fan go to full speed, like i remove the trackpad but it's connect on the board.
I have on pin 22 the 3V3 but not the 18V5 is it normal? what do you want to help me please?
it's my first post, thanks for your help.
best regards

threads.title: [SOLVED]Trackpad sensor 820-3115
threads.message: Add more information, the trackpad work (i change it too but not solve problem) but it's very slow (all the computer become slow).

threads.title: [SOLVED]Trackpad sensor 820-3115
threads.message:
[QUOTE="raainxx, post: 14698"]Hi,
i have a problem with this board 820-3115, i think it's a problem with sensor trackpad.
[/QUOTE]

Why? Did TS0P fail in ASD? Diid you run ASD 3S155 or 3S150 to confirm which sensor has failed?

threads.title: [SOLVED]Trackpad sensor 820-3115
threads.message: 18.5V missing, should be there, check booster circuit..   Trackpad should be connected of course...

threads.title: [SOLVED]Trackpad sensor 820-3115
threads.message: Very first thing to do is run EFI version of ASD to check for sensor issues.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Trackpad sensor 820-3115
threads.message:
Ok thanks to you, i download the ASD3S155, i come back to you with the result
When i measure the 18v5 the trackpad is connect but i have 0v.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Trackpad sensor 820-3115
threads.message:
i have the answer (error Temperature (TS0P) -- Palm Rest (test #1) - Sensor reads...... unable to read sensor -- TEST FAILED.
what can i try?
thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]Trackpad sensor 820-3115
threads.message: First thing is to try another known good trackpad complete with cable.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Trackpad sensor 820-3115
threads.message: Also try it with and without webcam plugged into the motherboard.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Trackpad sensor 820-3115
threads.message:
I already try with a new one same problem after some minutes fan full speed.
I try without webcam in few minutes.
thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]Trackpad sensor 820-3115
threads.message:
Run ASD again, with the other trackpad. Did you change trackpad cable too?
If still reports same error, check traces and contacts at J5800.
BTW, I wonder how can you move the cursor without 18V?
However this shouldn't make machine to work slow.
I recently worked one 3115 with shorted U5805 (in-out) and got 5v instead of 18.5V.
The click was working, cursor not moving, but OSX wasn't slow...

threads.title: [SOLVED]Trackpad sensor 820-3115
threads.message:
Ok i have remove the camera cable, after the ASD pass without any error, why? is it normal?
No trace liquid on the board, contact is good. Sorry but i have the 18V5, i make a mistake. Do you think the problem come by webcam?
thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]Trackpad sensor 820-3115
threads.message:
First post "18V5 missing", 11 post later,  "Sorry but i have the 18V5, i make a mistake"........ 

Camera and trackpad share SMBUS_SMC_2_S3_SCL and SMBUS_SMC_2_S3_SDA for communication with SMC, you have a bad camera cable, you can replace the cable or cut both lines on ths cable but will lose Ambient Light sensor feature...

threads.title: [SOLVED]Trackpad sensor 820-3115
threads.message: Look at page 52 of 109 and tell me why unplugging camera fixed it!

threads.title: [SOLVED]Trackpad sensor 820-3115
threads.message:
ok aprendiz i'm sorry but i'm a beginner on this kind of repair, i'm here to find help because i don't know how all board work, you are certainly very good in your work but not me.
I'm sorry for the mistake and with your help i find a problem with the camera cable, i change it and the mac work. thanks for your help all persons who help me
